data.title: Best Travel Agency Websites of 2024
data.meta_description: Are you looking for the best travel agency website of 2024? Awesome! I've collected the 27 most inspiring examples to inspire you!
data.text:
Definitive guide

How to create a mind-blowing travel agency website with/without a web designer

Best Travel Agency Websites of 2024 | 27+ Examples

Hi – it's Ralph here 👋

In the past 10 years, I’ve designed 15+ websites for Travel Agencies. Here’s what I learned:

What Matters in Travel Agencies Web Design (My Experience)

What I learned over the years building websites for Travel Agencies:

1. Destination Highlights

I encourage you to highlight the most visited landmarks on your home page with beautiful pictures and illustrations, and a few lines of text describing the place. This may include; famous tourist landmarks, cultural significant destinations, and other special activities that may be done in the destinations.

2. Package Details

I highly recommend including required information for each travel package such as travel detailing, services included/excluded in the cost, the prices and special discounts. Ensure you keep this information readily available and neatly organized in the website.

3. Special Deals and Promotions

Include any special offers, discounts or any offers related to the business on the homepage or any specific page related to that business. I suggest using banners or pop-ups to direct attention to these offers.

Focus on this, and you’ll be fine.

PS: I suggest taking a look at the website examples below. Get inspired by their designs and see which website builders they’ve used. Best of luck!

Home » Blogs » Best Travel Agency Websites of 2024 | 27+ Examples

Welcome friendly stranger! You're looking for some inspiring travel agency website designs. You found the right page.

My name is Ralph de Groot. I'm the founder and author at My Codeless Website. Wake me up for a great web design. I love writing about website examples, too!

P.S.: I always follow our editorial policy when writing my articles, to make sure they are really helpful and useful for you.

1. Adams & Butler

https://www.adamsandbutler.com/

Adams & Butler stands out as Ireland’s premier travel agency, renowned for a decade of excellence and crowned Best Travel Professional 2020 by the Irish Industry Travel Awards. Explore their website – a testament to luxury travel, with captivating design and stunning background videos that make them the hallmark of exceptional travel experiences.

Things we love about this travel agency website

Nice video background

Lots of white spaces

https://www.theglobalnomad.info/

Discover personalized travel with The Global Nomad, your premier travel agency. Tailor your journey by selecting from diverse packages, setting the duration, and choosing your planning process. Click “Plan My Trip,” and presto! Experience a unique adventure curated just for you. Travel with ease, guided by The Global Nomad.

FAQ

What makes a good travel agency website?

A travel agency design should have a clean design, be easy to navigate and include a lot of social proof. Have a look at this page for great example websites.

How to create a travel agency website?

Analyze the best examples on this page

Make notes of what you like – and what you don’t like

Design your own site with this drag & drop website builder

Publish your website with our recommended hosting platform.

How much does a travel agency website cost?

A web designer will charge anywhere between $1800 and $5000 for a decent website. However, this article will teach you to do it yourself for less than $100.

What information is needed on a travel agency website?

Your website will need at least the following pages: ‘Home, About us, Contact, Destinations. To create trust with your visitor it’s important to show lots of pictures of your destinations.

Next steps to build your travel agency website

1. Find a template to get started

When building a travel agency website, I prefer not to start from scratch. Get started with a template that you can 100% adjust to how you like it.

2. Try 14-Days For Free

I recommend Wix to build a travel agency website. If you use this button you can sign up and cancel within 14-days and get 100% of your money back no matter the reason.

3. Find a web designer

Don't want to build your travel agency website alone? Work with a web designer. I selected a few affordable yet amazing web designers for you.
